Key Match Events: Kiril Despodov scored the only goal of the match in the 40th minute after a mistake by Northern Ireland's goalkeeper Bailey Peacock-Farrell.
Aleksandar Kolev provided the assist for Despodov's goal.
Northern Ireland's goalkeeper Bailey Peacock-Farrell made a superb save from Georgi Kostadinov's effort.
Northern Ireland's Ciaron Brown cleared a goal-bound effort off the line.
Bulgaria hit the post twice in the first half.
Northern Ireland's Daniel Ballard had a header on goal deep into injury-time but it sailed wide.
Pre-Game Insights: Northern Ireland traveled to Bulgaria after a solid win over Luxembourg in their Nations League opener.
Bulgaria were unbeaten in seven matches heading into the game.
Post-Match Reflections: Northern Ireland's strong run of form came to an end with a frustrating 1-0 defeat.
Michael O'Neill expressed disappointment as Northern Ireland could not find an equalizer despite improving in the second half.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at Stadion Hristo Botev in Plovdiv with an attendance of 14,300.
The difficult pitch and stifling heat in Plovdiv affected Northern Ireland's performance.
Northern Ireland are now third in Group C3 after two matches.
